lines.text:
[Last lines]
Well, you've got your man.
Yes, I have and a very brave man.
I wouldn't have you for a friend, Gillie.

[Holding his gun]
Stick 'em up!
Drop that gun!
Don't move. I got yuh covered... It's loaded. Come any nearer and I'll shoot. I mean it. It's loaded. Put your hands up! Go on... put 'em up!
Shalln't I ever see you again?
Maybe... someday. It doesn't matter though. Whereever I am, you're still my friend.
Why did you do it? You know, shoot her?
I got angry... like a madman.
Why?
I don't know... because I loved her so much maybe. I came back to marry her. Then she said, just like that, "I don't want you anymore."
Why didn't she want you anymore?
She got someone else. A gentleman.
Got more cash, I suppose. I know! It's that man with the car. Horrid man. Always hanging around our place. You shoulda shot him instead.
I didn't want to shoot anyone.
But it was his fault! And I'll tell you another thing... he's got another wife as well!
What are we going to do? You've got to find her!
We'll find her, Mrs. Phillips. It'll be alright.

It'll be all right, he says. A fat lot of good the police are. We've got one in the house and a murder's done right under his nose and now here's a child whose got hold of a gun and they don't even know where she is!
We'll find her.

Gillie, look at me. Now in this world we sometimes have to tell little lies to help other people out. Our friends. Now we call this being loyal. Everybody admires and loves somebody whose loyal. But sometimes it is very wrong to tell even little lies if, by doing so, we help someone bad go free. Now that's not being loyal, Gillie. That's being very wicked. Now you don't want to be wicked, do you? Now this is the one moment that you must tell me the truth. The truth, Gillie.
[Pointing to Korchinsky]
This is the man you saw come out of the flat, isn't it? Isn't it? Look at him, Gillie. Look at him. This is the man isn't it, Gillie? Isn't it? Isn't it?
No, I've never seen him before in my life.
